column4: I have 4 gigs installed(& seen with dmidecode --type 17) yet free -m shows only 2757 total. can anyone help ?
!bl
maybe u need 64-bit
i am on a 64 bit machine
and using ubuntu 64bit ver
then, i dont know, see that link i7c said
in my case used+free not equal 4g
no idea
maybe you have integrated graphics on your motherboard or cpu that steals the RAM?
ssta is right, PAE is only for 32-bit.
of course it does, its cuz your userland is 64-bit, and pae is 32-bit
is there a way to override everythign with a previous version to wipe my pae blunder?
just uninstall the linux-generic-pae package and it will disappear as an option from bootloader
mine says MemTotal:        4048556 kB
do you have integrated graphics on the cpu or motherboard?
IG available yes but im using a gfx card
with an i7?
yes
when you boot the computer, what does BIOS/UEFI say, it should list the memory too
ill have to check next boot
weird
